title: Two Thunderbird accounts
content:
Wife and I have two separate desktops on a MS Win 11 PC (desktop). I have T-Bird ver 136.0 (64 bit) running on my side working perfectly. We just tried installing her old T-Bird account on her side, and after a while, we got it installed and are able to RECEIVE mail--also on ver 136.0 (64 bit), but can't SEND. However, there are two problems: 

  1.  Our two versions look quite different on our individual sides of the computer.  Why?   2.  As best we can determine, all our settings are the same; however, she can only receive--can't send emails.  She gets an instant constant error msg:  Unable to send, outgoing mail server xxxxxxxxx has timed out.  It's the same server I'm using!  We have triple-checked all settings between our two accounts, but still no luck.  We have checked with our email service provider (WOW!/Knology), and they have shown us how to set up their internet email account to use at a hotel when traveling, but not at our home PC.  Any help here would be GREATLY appreciated!

Many thanks, Jay
creator: Juvat1

title: Adaptive junk filtering is working backwards
content:
I've just resumed using Thunderbird, with a new installation on a new computer, after a long period of having only my ISP's web interface. I'm having a problem with adaptive junk filtering: it thinks everything is junk until I tell it otherwise.

By default, it leaves putative junk messages in the Inbox, but displays a yellow ribbon above a junk message's preview with "Learn more" and "Not junk" buttons. In this configuration, having it assume everything new is junk is just a nuisance.

But eventually I will finish training it, and I'll want it to move junk to the Junk folder automatically. Then this behavior will be a disaster.

Using made-up numbers to illustrate, suppose I get 1000 messages per day. Of these, 998 are from addresses it recognizes, so it knows that 993 of them are junk and 5 are legitimate, because I've received email from those addresses before, and I've told it what to do with them. That leaves 2 messages which may or may not be junk.

It should leave those messages in the Inbox, preferably with some kind of warning, and let me decide whether they are junk or not. Instead it's going to move them to Junk, and I'll never know I got them unless I review all 995 new messages in the Junk folder... which would defeat the whole point of having a junk filter.

Is there a way to make the junk filter default to "not junk" when it doesn't know? I've looked at the configuration dialog, and I don't see one.
creator: jsachs.sac

title: unified view of inbox and sent folder for single e-mail account
content:
[Thunderbird 128] Is it possible to unify the INBOX and SENT folders belonging to one account?

I get a lot of e-mail requests to wildly varying topics and need to keep them organised by topic, date, etc.

Thus I often want to store incoming requests (single e-mails or threads) and my answer(s) to them together in an offline (local) folder common only to that case. I do this by traversing the INBOX and the SENT folder separately and then moving corresponding items manually to the same offline folder. Since I have a super-hierarchical and massive offline folder structure, it takes a lot of time to navigate to the same folder twice, but I do not see how I can avoid that. Unifying INBOX and SENT folders would be a way out, I then have to traverse the combined folder only once.

Maybe I am doing something wrong or have overlooked something trivial - I would be grateful if somebody could point that out, too.
creator: molspin

title: "Sign in to Google" popup - argh!
content:
Please put Thunderbird back the way it was. I have several different email accounts in Thunderbird, I'm obviously logged into Google on one of those accounts, but for a while now TB constantly asks me to "Login to Google" - when I already am. i.e. It's asking me again and again, to login to one of the OTHER email/google accounts - and I don't want to, because I bet the moment I do, TB will popup the window again, wanting me to login to previous one. And so round and round we go.

Also the popup is poorly designed, because not all of it fits on the screen. i.e. It's oversized, so you can't see the top or bottom "bar" and there's no way I can see to adjust it. I detest this pointless popup, constantly appearing, having to first click on the white space, and then hit the ESC key to get rid of it (until next time). Why would you do this? We've always been able to have multiple email/gmail accounts, all with different login details, and all the email accounts still seem to be receiving email okay... so why add this annoying popup? Please remove it.
creator: RealFamilyMan

When I receive a mail the correspodent appears differently from what I have named the contact.Propably as the person sent me the email have named himself.The same applies in sent mails as well.No matter what I did ,it seems like the database from the address book is not linked to the mail database whatever I do. To sum up all of a sudden thunderbird decided to ingore my contact list and display all the senders either by they mail or by the name they have chosen. I have tried some actions in order to correct it and I end up having the same mail up to 10 times in my contacts and still on the inbox the sender was still displayed differently . title: Calendars disappear when calendar cache is enabled
content:
Dear support team, I've the following issue with calendars in Thunderbird. Was on latest ESR version, an upgrade to latest version 136.0.1 (64 bit) didn't fix it: When I started Thunderbird, suddenly most of my calendars where no longer visible. I figured out by trying to add a new calendar it only (re-)appeared when "offline mode" (caching) was disabled. After changing the setting calendar.registry.[id].cache.enabled to "false" the calendars showed up again.

Could it be some kind of bug or could the calendar storage be corrupt? How can I fix it?

Many thanks in advance for an answer!

Kind regards, H. Bruecher

title: Templates don't open.  Cannot create a new message from a template.
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for quite a while without any major issues, but yesterday, I ran into a problem that I cannot figure out.

I have a bunch of templates that I use regularly to create emails. The usual procedure is to click on a template email in the "Templates" folder, make the edits I need to the body content, modify the recipient information if necessary, hit send, and away goes a new message.

Yesterday, I click on a message in the Template folder, and nothing happens. The template message does not open up. If I right click and say "Create a new message from template" or whatever the exact prompt is, nothing happens. No new message is created.

I have tried creating a new message and saving it as a template, click on the new "template", and still nothing happens.

I have tried repairing the folder, using properties, but this is only offered if I click on the "Local" subfolder version, not on the "Unified" parent folder. No change.

I tried backing up the profile for security, deleting the "Template" message and index files, to try and see if recreating a new folder will work ... again, same results. Click on a template message and nothing happens. Right-click and select "create new message..." and nothing happens.

I have NOT tried creating a whole new profile yet since there are multiple email accounts, various custom search aggregations, and other customizations that have all been working just splendidly that I don't want to have to recreate all over if I can avoid it.

Running TBird 136.0 (64-bit) on Windows 11 which TBird reports is the latest / up-to-date version.

So far as I can tell, ALL of the other folders, sub-folders, local and IMAP, work as expected. I don't have this "message won't open" problem with any of them. This is affecting only templates and it's left me scratching my head.

Thank you in advance for your help, suggestions, and hopefully, solutions!

VictorZ
creator: victor46
